4.heading: Yeh, Phil, 1954-
4.title: "Comics Creative Composers : an Introduction to Comic Books Today"
4.author: by Phil Yeh
notes: Summary: An 'attempt to provide non comic book readers with an introduction to the comic book industry in America today.' Sections headed 'The Groo Crew' (about Sergio Aragones, Stan Sakai, and Tom Luth), 'Aardvark-Vanaheim, a Canadian Independent Comic Book Firm' (about Joshua Quagmire and Jim Valentino), and 'The Philippines and Comic Book Art' (about Alfredo Alcala and Leandro Martinez).

34.heading: Yelling.
34.title: "Boss as Caddy"
34.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Louie daydreams about golf, and after the boss yells at him his daydream includes the boss as his caddy.
Wordless strip.

35.heading: Yelling.
35.title: "El Eco"
35.author: [No author]
35.series: Condorito) p. 50 in Condorito de Oro, no. 74
notes: Mountainclimbers come upon Condorito yelling loudly and incoherently, and wonder if he's crazy or sick. Turns out he's the echo. The "plop!" at the end sends the mountaineers right off a cliff.

36.heading: Yelling.
36.title: "Fore"
36.author: Stantis.
notes: Summary: Before he gets knocked down, Dad asks what Toby yelled.

37.heading: Yelling.
37.title: "Grease Fire!"
37.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Beanz yells and runs from the house with a smoking pan.

38.heading: Yelling.
38.title: "Gronk!"
38.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: A passer-by on the road yells at a field of grazing dinosaurs.

39.heading: Yelling.
39.title: "I Hate It When They Take Divots"
39.author: Larry Wright.
notes: Series: Flea Sports.
Summary: Carlyle jumps straight up when a flea yells 'fore.'

40.heading: Yelling.
40.title: "I Hate Playing Golf in the Mountains"
40.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: General Halftrack yells 'fore,' and the echo seems to come from all directions.

41.heading: Yelling.
41.title: "I Just Met with the Mutineers and They Agreed to Bury the Hatchet"
41.author: Frank Johnson.
notes: Summary: Aarnie sees the hatchet coming and yells for Boner to duck.

42.heading: Yelling.
42.title: "I Stepped in Dog Doo. Where's the Hose?"
42.author: by Bill Watterson.
notes: Summary: Mom tells Calvin to stop yelling across the house, and come to the living room if he wants to talk to her.

43.heading: Yelling.
43.title: "I Yell at Him, and He Yells at Dan Rather"
43.author: Bill Yates
43.appears_in: p. 296 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1996 ed.

44.heading: Yelling.
44.title: "It's Programmed Into My Genes"
44.author: Dik Browne
44.appears_in: p. 31 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Do you think she actually likes having to yell and be bossy?

45.heading: Yelling.
45.title: "My Bike Sounds Like a Turkey Gobblin' Ever Since He First Used It!"
45.author: J
notes: (Born Forty Years Too Soon)
Summary: His garage is fourteen blocks from home so he has to use a bicycle to get to it, and people yell at him about the noise.

46.heading: Yelling.
46.title: "Next Week on Donahue"
46.author: by Tom Wilson
46.appears_in: p. 19 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Donahue will feature men who cheat on wives and taxes, yell at kids and kick dogs.

47.heading: Yelling.
47.title: "Nobody Loves You When You're Down and Out"
47.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Helga yells at Snert: Down! and Hagar yells at Snert: Out! and Snert feels sorry for himself.
Gag attributed to Chris Browne by Mike Peters, reprinted on p. 104 of Hogan's Alley, v. 1, no. 2 (1995).

48.heading: Yelling.

48.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: His wife's driving him crazy because he stops at the tavern, so why doesn't he go straight home?

49.heading: Yelling.

notes: Summary: Everything in the house is chopped up, and Jon yells at Garfield, who's standing there with a hatchet.

notes: Summary: Louie's mess on deck caused an enemy to slip and saved Captain Crow's life, and Louie gets a medal and a little confusion.

161.heading: The Yellow Kid--Miscellanea.
161.title: "The People Laugh"
161.author: John W
161.appears_in: Dodds. chapter 8 (p. 213-235) in his Everyday Life in Twentieth Century America (New York : Putnam, 1965).
notes: Summary: Discussion of humor magazines, comedians, satire and comics, with sample illustrations by Clare Briggs (When a Feller Needs a Friend), John Held Jr., Charles Schulz (Peanuts), R.F. Outcault (The Yellow Kid, Buster Brown), F. Opper (Happy Hooligan), R. Dirks (The Katzenjammer Kids), George McManus (Bringing Up Father), Bud Fisher (Mutt and Jeff), Frank King (Gasoline Alley), and mention of others.
